DOC.detailed_description: Background : Nurses play important role help patient manage symptom , adhere treatment , change behavior . There lack research regard nonpharmacologic intervention patient heart failure chronic condition . Objectives : The primary objective 4-year study determine effect nurse-led behavioral management intervention health-related quality patient medically-managed heart failure . The secondary objective ass impact behavioral management intervention health care resource utilization . Methods : DESIGN : randomize controlled trial . SETTING : single site , VA San Diego Healthcare System . SAMPLE : Patients enrol 11 cohort total 116 outpatient randomly assign one two treatment group evaluate clinical impact intervention . Group 1 receive usual care patient heart failure ( n=58 ) . Group 2 augment group receive usual care plus participation 15-week ( 4-month ) behavioral management program ( n=58 ) . Inclusion criteria patient primary diagnosis heart failure , VA primary care provider , stable symptom least one month able walk . INTERVENTION : The behavioral management program augment usual care consist establish specific goal patient related healthy diet , increased quality amount exercise , smoke cessation , increase social interpersonal activity . DEPENDENT VARIABLES/OUTCOME MEASURES : The five major dependent variable study psychological symptom distress ( Multiple Affect Adjective Check List - MAACL ) , physical functioning ( SF-36 physical component summary score ) , mental functioning ( SF-36 mental component summary score ) , exercise capability ( 6-Minute Walk ) , general health perception ( SF-36 general health scale score ) . Dependent variable assess baseline , end treatment ( 4 month ) , 10 16 month . DATA ANALYSIS : Initial analysis include subject randomize treatment complete data collection time point series 2 4 ANOVAs time repeat measure . Status : Completed . Final report submit August 2003
